content:
ITEM NO.40               COURT NO.12               SECTION XII
               S U P R E M E  C O U R T  O F  I N D I A
                       RECORD OF PROCEEDINGS
Petition(s) for Special Leave to Appeal (C)  No(s).  17220/2025
[Arising out of impugned final judgment and order dated  21-05-2025
in WMP No. 20576/2025 passed by the High Court of Judicature at
Madras]
THE STATE OF TAMIL NADU & ANR.                     Petitioner(s)
                                VERSUS
K. VENKATACHALAPATHY @KUTTY & ORS.                 Respondent(s)
IA No. 150314/2025 - EXEMPTION FROM FILING C/C OF THE IMPUGNED 
JUDGMENT
IA No. 150737/2025 - PERMISSION TO FILE ADDITIONAL 
DOCUMENTS/FACTS/ANNEXURES
 
Date : 04-07-2025 This matter was called on for hearing today.
CORAM :  HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE PAMIDIGHANTAM SRI NARASIMHA
         HON'BLE MR. JUSTICE R. MAHADEVAN
(PARTIAL COURT WORKING DAYS BENCH)
For Petitioner(s) :Mr. P. S. Raman, Adv. General
                   Mr. Rakesh Dwivedi, Sr. Adv. 
                   Mr. Abhishek Manu Singhvi, Sr. Adv.
                   Mr. P. Wilson, Sr. Adv.
                   Mr. Saran Raghunandhan, Sr. Adv. 
                   Ms. Misha Rohatgi Mohta, AOR
                   Mr. Nakul Mohta, Adv.
                   Mr. Apoorv Malhotra, Adv.
                   Mr. Ayush Kashyap, Adv.
                   Mr. Aditya Dhingra, Adv.
                   Mr. Amulya Upadhyay, Adv.
                   Mr. Eklavya Dwivedi, Adv.
                   Mr. Mohd. Yasir, Adv.
                   Mr. Uday Bhatia, Adv.
                   Mr. Lokesh Krishna, Adv.
                   Mr. Aditya Ojha, Adv.
                   Mr. Aravind A., Adv. 
                   
For Respondent(s) :Mr. Manoj Ranjan Sinha, Adv.
                   Mr. Mrigank Prabhakar, AOR
                   Mr. Vishal Agrawal, Adv.
                                                         
                   Mr. D.S. Naidu, Sr. Adv.
1 of 2                   Mr. Ravi Prakash, Sr. Adv.
                   Ms. Astu Khandelwal, Adv.
                   Mr. Yasharth Shukla, Adv.
                   Mr. Samir Malik, AOR
                   
          UPON hearing the counsel the Court made the following
                             O R D E R
1.Issue notice on the prayer for interim relief as well as on
the Special Leave Petition.
2.The respondents shall file their response in the meanwhile.
3. List along with Civil Appeal No. 53 of 2025. 
4.Liberty is granted to the parties to mention before Honâ€™ble
the Chief Justice of India for advancing of the hearing of this
batch of matters.
(KAPIL TANDON)                                  (NIDHI WASON)
COURT MASTER (SH)                             COURT MASTER (NSH)
2 of 2
